latestVersion.termsOfAccess:
Project files like raw data, coding guidelines and questionnaires can now be directly downloaded from this site.
Please see also SSD's Farm Household Survey Database (http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/).
latestVersion.dataAccessPlace: All files for this project/study, except for the Project Description, need to be directly downloaded from SSD's Farm Household Survey Database's online link: http://ricestat.irri.org/fhsd/

dsDescriptionValue.value: To examine how such a pattern of agrarian change has emerged through the interaction of land reform with strong population pressure and the development of new technology.  To trace the sudden surge of cottage manufacturing that occurred in the village - that increased employment opportunities for villagers and pulled significant amount of external labor into the village.

keywordValue.value: New rice technology, modern inputs, total factor productivity, rural poverty, inequality, land-tenure reforms, industrialization, subcontracting network, cottage manufacturing

fields.value: Subject: Number of Repondents  Type: Sample Size  Notes: 241;
